S

saveToCsv() - Method in class GIS.filehandling.FileHandler
This method creates an object of type createfile; it saves the contents of GIS.drawing.Content into a csv file.
SelectedPointlist - Variable in class GIS.drawing.Content
List of Point Objects actually selected
SelectedPolygonlist - Variable in class GIS.drawing.Content
List of Polygons Objects actually selected
SelectedPolylinelist - Variable in class GIS.drawing.Content
List of Polyline Objects actually selected
selectGeometries(Rectangle2D) - Method in class GIS.drawing.Content
Select all Geometries of the Content which are contained by a user defined rectangle.
setContent(Content) - Method in class GIS.GIS
Update the GIS Content after a DB or CSV import.
setGeometryFromText(String) - Method in class GIS.geometry.GISPoint
when receiving a point from a DB/CSV it will be stored in the string: "1.234 5.678" setGeometryFromText("1.234 5.678") will split the string at the " " and return an Array with x and y values, which then can be assigned to this.x and this.y.
setGeometryFromText(String) - Method in class GIS.geometry.GISPolyline
when receiving a feature geometry from a DB/CSV it will be stored in the string: "1.234 5.678,4.321 8.765" textToPoint("1.234 5.678,4.321 8.765") will split the string at the "," to receive the different points. " " spereates their x and y coordinates.
setLayout() - Method in class GIS.GIS
Sets the layout of the GIS.
setPan(double, double, double) - Method in class GIS.drawing.DrawingPanel
Forward the zoomfactor and horizontal/vertical offset defined by the users zooming and panning
setSelectionRectangle(Rectangle2D) - Method in class GIS.drawing.DrawingPanel
Set the private selection rectangle to the user defined rectangle
setTypeToPolygon() - Method in class GIS.geometry.GISPolyline
The class GISPolygon inherits from GISPolyline and must be able to change the type of the Geometry class to "Polygon".
setUniqueID(Content) - Method in class GIS.geometry.Geometry
Loops through all actualy drawn GIS objects and returns the maximum id + 1.
